00001 /*---------------------------------------------------------*
00002  * PORTABLE.H -- type and macro definitions for portable C *
00003  *                                                         *
00004  * Parts taken from:                                       *
00005  *                                                         *
00006  * PORTABLE C AND UNIX SYSTEM PROGRAMMING.                 *
00007  * J E Lapin                                               *
00008  * Prentice-Hall, Englewood Hills, 1987                    *
00009  *                                                         *
00010  * Enhanced august the 24th, 1988 by J R Valverde          *
00011  *---------------------------------------------------------*/
00012 
00013 /* guard against multiple inclusion */
00014 #ifndef _PORTABLE_H_
00015 
00016 #ifdef MEM_DEBUG
00017 #include "mshell.h"
00018 #endif
00019 
00020 /*----------------------------------------------------------------
00021     Standard types
00022 ----------------------------------------------------------------*/
00023 
00024 #ifdef bool
00025 #undef bool
00026 #endif
00027 
00028 typedef int     bool;           /* >= 16 bits used as boolean   */
00029 typedef int     boolean;
00030 typedef char    flag;           /* >= 8 bits used as boolean    */
00031 
00032 typedef unsigned short word;    /* >= 16 bit  unsigned type     */
00033 
00034 typedef int     rchar;          /* I/O function return values   */
00035 typedef char   *string;         /* for readability              */
00036 
00037 typedef int     status;         /* function status on return    */
00038 
00039 /* If void is not supported, uncomment the following line.      */
00040 /* typedef int  void;   */
00041 /* ------>    #define   DEFAULT int        Default size         */
00042 
00043 
00044 /*--------------------------------------------------------------
00045    Use this length and type for filename variables -- use
00046    256 on 4.2BSD since it is defined as such in dir.h   
00047 --------------------------------------------------------------*/
00048 
00049 #ifndef MAXPATHLEN
00050 #define MAXPATHLEN  64
00051 #endif
00052 typedef char    path[MAXPATHLEN];
00053 
00054 
00055 /*--------------------------------------------------------------
00056    Define byte and BYTE to portably support an unsigned
00057    8 bit data type (see Section 2.9.1 in text).         
00058 --------------------------------------------------------------*/
00059 
00060 /*      If char is signed by default and unsigned keyword is
00061         not allowed with char, byte and BYTE are:
00062 typedef char      byte;                         * 8 bit unsigned type   * /
00063 #define BYTE(x)   (byte) ((x) & 0xff)           * BYTE truncates data   */
00064 
00065 /*      else they are:  */
00066 typedef unsigned char byte;
00067 #define BYTE(x)   (byte) ((x) & 0xff)
00068 
00069 
00070 /*---------------------------------------------------------------
00071    Standard macros
00072 ---------------------------------------------------------------*/
00073 
00074 #define HIBYTE(x)       (((x) >> 8) & 0xff)     /* hi byte of short     */
00075 #define LOBYTE(x)       ((x) & 0xff)            /* lo byte of short     */
00076 #define HIWORD(x)       (((x) >> 16) & 0xffffL) /* upper half of long   */
00077 #define LOWORD(x)       ((x) & 0xffffL)         /* lower half of long   */
00078 #define CHAR(x)         ((x) & 0x7F)            /* Truncate to 7 bits   */
00079 #define ASCII(x)        ((x) & 0x7F)            /* Convert to ascii     */
00080 #define WORD(x)         ((x) & 0xffffL)         /* Truncate to 16 bits  */
00081 #define DECODE(x)       ((int) ((x) - '0'))     /* int value of a digit */
00082 
00083 /* long unsigned right shift */
00084 #define LURSHIFT(n, b) (((long) (n) >> (b)) & (0x7fffffffL >> ((b) - 1)))
00085 
00086 /* number of elements in array a */
00087 #define DIM(a)          (sizeof(a)/sizeof(*(a)))
00088 
00089 /*----------------------------------------------------------------
00090    Macros for bit manipulation
00091 ----------------------------------------------------------------*/
00092 
00093 #define BIT_0   0x01
00094 #define BIT_1   0x02
00095 #define BIT_2   0x04
00096 #define BIT_3   0x08
00097 #define BIT_4   0x10
00098 #define BIT_5   0x20
00099 #define BIT_6   0x40
00100 #define BIT_7   0x80
00101 #define BIT_8   0x100
00102 #define BIT_9   0x200
00103 #define BIT_10  0x400
00104 #define BIT_11  0x800
00105 #define BIT_12  0x1000
00106 #define BIT_13  0x2000
00107 #define BIT_14  0x4000
00108 #define BIT_15  0x8000
00109 #define BIT_16  0x10000
00110 #define BIT_17  0x20000
00111 #define BIT_18  0x40000
00112 #define BIT_19  0x80000
00113 #define BIT_20  0x100000
00114 #define BIT_21  0x200000
00115 #define BIT_22  0x400000
00116 #define BIT_23  0x800000
00117 #define BIT_24  0x1000000
00118 #define BIT_25  0x2000000
00119 #define BIT_26  0x4000000
00120 #define BIT_27  0x8000000
00121 #define BIT_28  0x10000000
00122 #define BIT_29  0x20000000
00123 #define BIT_30  0x40000000
00124 #define BIT_31  0x80000000
00125 
00126 #define BitTest(x, bit) ((x) & (bit))
00127 
00128 #define BitSet(x, bit)  ((x) |= (bit))
00129 
00130 #define BitClr(x, bit)  ((x) &= ~(bit))
00131 
00132 #define BitAnd(x, y)    ((x) & (y))
00133 
00134 #define BitOr(x, y)     ((x) | (y))
00135 
00136 #define BitXor(x, y)    ((x) ^ (y))
00137 
00138 #define BitNot(x)       (~(x))
00139 
00140 #define BitShift(x, count)      ( ((count) > 0)? (x) << (count) : (x) >> (count) )

00143 /*----------------------------------------------------------------
00144    Scope control pseudo-keywords
00145 ----------------------------------------------------------------*/
00146 
00147 #define public                  /* public is C default scope    */
00148 #define private static          /* static really means private  */
00149 #define LOCAL   auto            /* Local var on 68000           */
00150 #define EXTERN  extern          /* External variable            */
00151 #define MLOCAL  static          /* Local to module              */
00152 #define GLOBAL                  /* Global variable              */
00153

00156    Standard constants
00157 ----------------------------------------------------------------*/
00158 
00159 #ifndef TRUE
00160 #define TRUE    (1)             /* for use with booleans        */
00161 #endif
00162 
00163 #ifndef FALSE
00164 #define FALSE   (0)
00165 #endif
00166 
00167 #define YES     (1)             /* "TRUE"                       */
00168 #define NO      (0)             /* "FALSE"                      */
00169 
00170 #define SUCCEED ( 0)            /* for use in exit()            */
00171 #define FAILURE (-1)            /* for exit() & error returns   */
00172 #define FAIL    (-1)            /* Function failure return val  */
00173 #define SUCCESS ( 0)            /* Function success return val  */
00174 
00175 #define EOL     '\n'            /* end of line char             */
00176 #define EOS     '\0'            /* end of string char           */
00177 #define EOP     '\14'           /* end of page (FF) char        */
00178 
00179 #ifndef EOF
00180 #define EOF     (-1)            /* EOF Value                    */
00181 #endif
00182 
00183 #define FOREVER for(;;)         /* Infinite loop declaration    */
00184 /*   #define    NULL    0          Null pointer value           */
00185 #define NULLPTR (char *) 0      /* Pointer to NULL              */
